ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Ever experienced traumatic event
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Please briefly describe the experience which is the most distressing and the most haunting for you currently
Does this traumatic event include: Actual or threatened death
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Does this traumatic event include: Actual or threatened serious injury
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Does this traumatic event include: Actual or threatened sexual violation
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: When did this most traumatic event first occur? Enter your age or date.
Have you had unwanted distressing memories about the trauma
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you been having bad dreams or nightmares related to the trauma?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: In your lifetime, how much were you bothered by suddenly acting or feeling as if a stressful experience were happening again (as if you were reliving it)?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= A little bit; 2= Moderately; 3= Quite a bit; 4= Extremely; 444= Do not wish to respond; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: Have you been very EMOTIONALLY upset when reminded of the trauma?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: In your lifetime, how much were you bothered by having physical reactions (e.g., heart pounding, trouble breathing, or sweating) when something reminded you of a stressful experience
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= A little bit; 2= Moderately; 3= Quite a bit; 4= Extremely; 444= Do not wish to respond; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: Have you been making efforts to avoid thoughts or feelings related to the trauma
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you been making efforts to avoid activities, situations, or places that remind you of the trauma or that feel more dangerous since the trauma?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Are there any important parts of the trauma that you cannot remember?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you been viewing yourself, others, or the world in a more negative way (e.g."I can't trust people," "I'm a weak person")?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you blamed yourself for the trauma or for what happened afterwards?  Have you blamed others that did not directly cause the event for the trauma or what happened afterwards
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Having strong negative feelings such as fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame?
Notes: 1=not at all; 2= a little bit; 3=moderately; 4=quite a bit; 5= extremely; 999=NA/NK/missing/Refused

ElementDescription: Loss of interest in activities that you used to enjoy PX630301_PTSD_Symptoms_LossOf_Interest
Notes: 1=not at all; 2= a little bit; 3=moderately; 4=quite a bit; 5= extremely

ElementDescription: Have you felt detached or cut off from others?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Trouble experiencing positive feelings (for example, being unable to feel happiness or have loving feelings for people close to you)
Notes: 1=not at all; 2= a little bit; 3=moderately; 4=quite a bit; 5= extremely; 999=NA/NK/missing/Refused

ElementDescription: Have you been acting more irritable or aggressive?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you been taking more risks or doing things that might cause you or others harm (e.g., driving recklessly, taking drugs, having unprotected sex)?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you been overly alert or on-guard (e.g., checking to see who is around you, etc.)?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have you been jumpier or more easily startled?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Having difficulty concentrating PX630301_PTSD_Symptoms_Concentrating
Notes: 1=not at all; 2= a little bit; 3=moderately; 4=quite a bit; 5= extremely

ElementDescription: Have you had difficulty falling or staying asleep?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: How much have these difficulties been bothering you?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: How much have these difficulties been interfering with your everyday life (e.g. relationships, work, or                 other important activities)?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: How long after the trauma did these difficulties begin?
How long have you had these trauma-related difficulties?
PSSI Total Score
PTSD diagnosis
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes; 2= Incomplete information

ElementDescription: Have there been times when things going on around you seemed unreal or very strange and unfamiliar?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 = Times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Have there been times where you felt as if you were outside of your body; watching yourself as if you were another person?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Once a week or less/a little; 2= 2 to 3 times a week/somewhat; 3= 4 to 5 = Times a week/very much; 4= 6 or more times a week/severe

ElementDescription: Having strong negative feelings such as fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame?
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = A little bit; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Quite a bit; 4 = Extremely; 9 = Blank/Missing

ElementDescription: Loss of interest in activities that you used to enjoy
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = A little bit; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Quite a bit; 4 = Extremely; 9 = Blank/Missing

ElementDescription: Trouble experiencing positive feelings (for example, being unable to feel happiness or have loving feelings for people close to you)
Notes: 0 = Not at all; 1 = A little bit; 2 = Moderately; 3 = Quite a bit; 4 = Extremely; 9 = Blank/Missing
